question: Both the poor and the rich find the accessibility into university difficult. Do you agree or disagree?
text: In the modern world, academic education is essential for every individual to achieve life goals and dreams. However, enrolled in the university for poor people is no longer an easy task due to extreme competition among modern learners. But I believe money can buy an education, so I will not fully agree with this statement.

Firstly, many universities around the world that provide quality tuition nowadays. Therefore, numerous students travel to complete their studies by finding their desired campus. In other word, student those who have money able to do their studies without hesitation while the poor struggle with their financial issues. Lack of resources is another issue some of the individuals who suffer from a difficult lifestyle. Secondly, In the modern world, there are many private universities, which provide private education. Even the teenager who not at university-level, with money they can conduct their studies enrolling with the campus.
